page.title: 11Change of use of Buildings
page.content: The area is dotted with small cottages and farms, many of which have been purchased and used as holiday retreats. Farmhouse accommodation for the holidaying public is also much in evidence. Many of the cottages, which were bought for holidays originaly are not being used as permanent homes as their owners are finding themselves prematurely out of work and retired from their places of employment or made redundant by this Conservative government's economic measures. This is bringing the younder people back into the area with children and thus reversing the trend of years ago when the young were leaving the land to work in the Cities. Rundown farms and smallholding are being modernised by both the Welsh and English and being farmed again by these people trying to make a new lifestyle.
